body:
## Release Notes

## Features

- Add check that we don't use `sizeof(ptr)`. @iphydf (#146)
- Improved type checking. @iphydf (#144)
- Check for returning 1/0 in bool functions. @iphydf (#142)
- Add stronger checks on casts. @iphydf (#140)
- Add `select()` to the libc headers. @iphydf (#137)
- Check boolean conversions inside logical operators. @iphydf (#135)
- Implement stronger type checking in assignments. @iphydf (#131)
- Add support for everything needed by toxav. @iphydf (#130)
- Add type checking tool using language-c. @iphydf (#127)
- Check that all pointer arguments have nullability annotations. @iphydf (#122)
- Add check to make sure we don't pass large structs by value. @iphydf (#117)
- Add enum-names check. @iphydf (#113)
- Stricter checks on malloc size argument. @iphydf (#111)
- Add more functions to the unsafe list with explanations. @iphydf (#110)
- Add "unsafe function" checker. @iphydf (#109)
- Check that memcpy is not used where assignment could be used. @iphydf (#104)
- Check that function arguments don't have `()` around them. @iphydf (#105)
- Check that `malloc` is only used for builtin types. @iphydf (#103)
- Check calloc argument order and cast type. @iphydf (#102)
- Add check that Logger is always passed as ptr-to-const. @iphydf (#101)
- Add check for useless parentheses. @iphydf (#100)
- Show suggestions for misspelled defns. @iphydf (#97)
- Check that typedef structs share the name with the struct. @iphydf (#96)
- Add check for variables that can be reduced in scope. @iphydf (#95)

## Performance improvements

- Use non-copying TraverseAst. @iphydf (#119)
- Run tokstyle checkers in parallel. @iphydf (#106)

## Bug Fixes

- Add `struct` to the list of types that aren't pointers. @iphydf (#147)
- Remove exemption for binary expressions in if stmts. @iphydf (#139)
- Allow int-to-enum conversion. @iphydf (#136)

## Maintenance (Grunt tasks)

- Add a new enum to the exemptions list. @iphydf (#134)
- Add check-c to the cabal file. @iphydf (#129)
- Add common CI workflow, currently includes buildifier. @iphydf (#126)
- Add Packet_Direction enum to exemption list @JFreegman (#123)
- Use toktok-stack image for haskell stack builds. @iphydf (#125)
- Use the docker image for CI builds. @iphydf (#124)
- Use latest instead of versioned toktok-stack image. @iphydf (#115)
- Upgrade to latest toktok-stack @iphydf (#114)
- Link check-cimple with `-rtsopts` to allow more parallelism. @iphydf (#108)
- Fix buildifier warning. @iphydf (#107)
- Use standard CI workflow now that it's downgraded. @iphydf (#94)
- Add bazel file for the web app. @iphydf (#93)
- Rename Cimple.Analysis to Linter. @iphydf (#91)
- Add newline to the `/source` endpoint in the web app. @iphydf (#90)
- Use check_release without the path argument. @iphydf (#89)
- Checkout current repo before ci-tools. @iphydf (#88)
- Fix ci-tools checkout. @iphydf (#87)
- Use the hackage_upload script from ci-tools. @iphydf (#86)
- Use ci-tools for check_release. @iphydf (#85)
- Fix path to check_release. @iphydf (#84)
- Check that GitHub release name matches the one in BUILD.bazel. @iphydf (#82)
- Use the same cache key in publish and ci workflows. @iphydf (#81)

## Maintenance (Code cleanup)

- Slight code improvements. @iphydf (#148)
- Slight improvement of this ugly code. @iphydf (#133)
- Remove obsolete checker. @iphydf (#121)
- Remove Node_format from exemptions list for memcpy. @iphydf (#116)
- Remove `Cmp_data` exemptions. @iphydf (#112)

## Maintenance (Refactoring)

- Update to changed AST representation in cimple. @iphydf (#99)
- Use new y-combinator based AST from Cimple. @iphydf (#92)
name: v0.0.9
